extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small butternut squash (2 pounds)—peeled, seeded and cut into 1-inch dice
extendedIngredients.originalName: small butternut squash —peeled, seeded and cut into 1-inch dice

extendedIngredients.name: carrots
extendedIngredients.original: 4 medium carrots (3/4 pound), peeled and sliced 1/4 inch thick on the bias
extendedIngredients.originalName: medium carrots , peeled and sliced 1/4 inch thick on the bias

extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower
extendedIngredients.original: 1 medium head cauliflower (2 1/2 pounds), cut into 1-inch florets
extendedIngredients.originalName: medium head cauliflower , cut into 1-inch florets

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.original: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

title: Maple-Ginger-Roasted Vegetables with Pecans
summary: Maple-Ginger-Roasted Vegetables with Pecans might be just the side dish you are searching for. This caveman, gluten free, primal, and vegan recipe serves 12 and costs $1.81 per serving. One portion of this dish contains about 6g of protein, 19g of fat, and a total of 304 calories. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. A mixture of brussels sprouts, pecans, carrots, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 1 hour and 30 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is awesome. Try Roasted Winter Vegetables With A Maple-ginger Glaze, 5-Minute Maple-Ginger Glazed Pecans, and Roasted Maple Pecans for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425. Spread the pecans in a pie plate and toast until fragrant, about 6 minutes. Let cool.                                              In a large bowl, toss the carrots, parsnips, cauliflower, squash and brussels sprouts with the olive oil and nutmeg and season generously with salt and black pepper. Spread the vegetables on 2 large rimmed baking sheets and roast for 30 minutes, until the vegetables begin to brown. Scatter the pecans and ginger over the vegetables and drizzle with the maple syrup; toss well. Continue to roast the vegetables for 25 minutes longer, until they are tender and golden. Scrape the vegetables into a bowl and serve hot or at room temperature.

steps.step: Spread the pecans in a pie plate and toast until fragrant, about 6 minutes.
In a large bowl, toss the carrots, parsnips, cauliflower, squash and brussels sprouts with the olive oil and nutmeg and season generously with salt and black pepper.

Spread the vegetables on 2 large rimmed baking sheets and roast for 30 minutes, until the vegetables begin to brown. Scatter the pecans and ginger over the vegetables and drizzle with the maple syrup; toss well. Continue to roast the vegetables for 25 minutes longer, until they are tender and golden. Scrape the vegetables into a bowl and serve hot or at room temperature.
